info.name: Nutrition Stack API
info.description:
API collection for the Nutrition Stack Web API - User Authentication

ðŸ” **Token Management**:
- Run 'Register User' or 'Login User' first to get a JWT token
- The token is automatically saved and used by all other requests
- If you get 401/403 errors, the token is automatically cleared - just login again
- No need to manually copy-paste tokens!

ðŸ½ï¸ **Meal Management Variables**:
- `{{mealId}}`: Set this to the ID of the meal you want to work with
- `{{productEan}}`: Set this to the EAN13 code of the product you want to work with
- These variables make it easy to test different meals and products without changing URLs

variable.description: ID of the meal to work with
EAN13 code of the product to work with
ID of the goal to work with

exec: // Collection-level script to handle authentication errors
console.log('Please login again to get a new token');

request.description: Register a new user account

exec: // Extract token from response and set as collection variable
console.log('User registered and logged in automatically');

request.description: Login with existing user credentials

exec: // Extract token from response and set as collection variable

request.description: Get current user's profile information
Update both username and password
Update only username (password remains unchanged)
Update only password (username remains unchanged)
Delete current user's account permanently

Create a new nutrition goal for the current user

Body:
- caloriesGoal: Daily calorie goal (required, 800-10000)
- proteinGoal: Daily protein goal in grams (optional, non-negative)
- carbsGoal: Daily carbs goal in grams (optional, non-negative)
- fatGoal: Daily fat goal in grams (optional, non-negative)

Business Rules:
- Only one active goal per user at a time
- Previous goals are automatically deactivated
- Calories goal must be between 800-10000 for health
- Macronutrient ratios are validated for balance

Get the current user's active nutrition goal

Business Rules:
- Returns the currently active goal
- Returns 400 if no active goal exists
- Only shows goals for the authenticated user

Get all nutrition goals for the current user (current and historical)

Business Rules:
- Returns all goals ordered by creation date (newest first)
- Includes both active and inactive goals
- Only shows goals for the authenticated user

Get a specific nutrition goal by ID

Path Variables:
- goalId: ID of the goal to retrieve

Business Rules:
- Returns 404 if goal not found
- Only shows goals for the authenticated user

Update an existing nutrition goal

Path Variables:
- goalId: ID of the goal to update

Body:
- caloriesGoal: Daily calorie goal (optional, 800-10000)
- proteinGoal: Daily protein goal in grams (optional, non-negative)
- carbsGoal: Daily carbs goal in grams (optional, non-negative)
- fatGoal: Daily fat goal in grams (optional, non-negative)

Business Rules:
- Partial updates are supported (only provide fields to change)
- All provided values are validated
- Returns 400 if no updates provided
- Only the goal owner can update their goals

Delete (deactivate) a nutrition goal

Path Variables:
- goalId: ID of the goal to delete

Business Rules:
- Goals are soft-deleted (marked as inactive)
- Historical data is preserved
- Returns 204 on successful deletion
- Only the goal owner can delete their goals

Reactivate a previously inactive nutrition goal

Path Variables:
- goalId: ID of the goal to reactivate

Business Rules:
- Deactivates the current active goal
- Reactivates the specified goal
- Returns the reactivated goal details
- Only the goal owner can reactivate their goals
- Goal must exist and belong to the user
- Useful for switching back to previous nutrition strategies

Create a new product

Body:
- ean13Code: 13-digit EAN13 code (required)
- productName: Product name (required)
- amount: Serving amount (required, must be > 0)
- unit: Unit of measurement (required, max 50 chars)
- calories: Calories per unit (optional, non-negative)
- protein: Protein in grams (optional, non-negative)
- carbs: Carbohydrates in grams (optional, non-negative)
- fat: Fat in grams (optional, non-negative)
- fiber: Fiber in grams (optional, non-negative)
- sugar: Sugar in grams (optional, non-negative)
- salt: Salt in grams (optional, non-negative)

Business Rules:
- Authenticated users can create products
- EAN13 code must be unique
- Amount must be greater than 0
- All nutrition values must be non-negative

Get product information by EAN13 code

Path Variables:
- ean13Code: 13-digit EAN13 code

Business Rules:
- Authenticated users can look up products
- Returns 404 if product not found

Update product information

Path Variables:
- ean13Code: 13-digit EAN13 code

Body:
- All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated
- productName: Product name (max 255 chars)
- amount: Serving amount (must be > 0)
- unit: Unit of measurement (max 50 chars)
- calories: Calories per unit (non-negative)
- protein: Protein in grams (non-negative)
- carbs: Carbohydrates in grams (non-negative)
- fat: Fat in grams (non-negative)
- fiber: Fiber in grams (non-negative)
- sugar: Sugar in grams (non-negative)
- salt: Salt in grams (non-negative)

Business Rules:
- **SECURITY: Only the product creator or admin can update products**
- If a user tries to update a product they didn't create, they will receive a 403 Forbidden error
- Error message: 'Access denied: You can only update products you created. Product [name] was created by another user.'
- Partial updates supported - only provided fields are updated
- Amount must be greater than 0
- All nutrition values must be non-negative

Delete a product (Admin only)

Path Variables:
- ean13Code: 13-digit EAN13 code

Business Rules:
- Only admins can delete products
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone

Get all products in the system

Business Rules:
- Authenticated users can view all products
- Returns list of all products with nutrition information

item.name: Logged Products

request.description:
Log a product consumption with quantity, unit, and meal type. The system will automatically calculate nutrition values based on the product's EAN13 code and the specified quantity.

Body:
- ean13Code: 13-digit EAN13 code (required)
- quantity: Amount consumed (required, must be > 0)
- unit: Unit of measurement (required)
- mealType: Type of meal (required: breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack)
- logDate: When the product was consumed (optional, defaults to current time automatically)

Note: logDate is completely optional - if not provided, the system automatically sets it to the current time.

Business Rules:
- Authenticated users can log products
- Product must exist in the system
- Quantity must be greater than 0
- Log date is automatically set to current time if not provided
- Nutrition values are automatically calculated based on product data and quantity

Response Format:
Returns simplified data with only essential fields and calculated nutrition values

Get all logged products for the current user, ordered by log date (newest first)

Returns:
- Logged product details
- Calculated nutrition values based on quantity consumed
- Product information (name, EAN13)
- Meal type and log date

Response Format:
Returns simplified data with only essential fields and calculated nutrition values

Get a specific logged product by its ID. The response includes calculated nutrition values based on the logged quantity and product information.

Path Variables:
- logId: The ID of the logged product to retrieve

Business Rules:
- Users can only access their own logged products
- Returns 404 if logged product not found or doesn't belong to user

Response Format:
Returns simplified data with only essential fields and calculated nutrition values

Update a logged product's quantity, unit, meal type, or log date. Only the fields you want to change need to be included in the request body.

Path Variables:
- logId: The ID of the logged product to update

Body (all optional):
- quantity: New amount consumed
- unit: New unit of measurement
- mealType: New meal type
- logDate: New log date (only needed if you want to change the timestamp)

Business Rules:
- Users can only update their own logged products
- Quantity must be greater than 0 if provided
- Log date cannot be in the future if provided
- Nutrition values are automatically recalculated

Response Format:
Returns simplified data with only essential fields and calculated nutrition values

Delete a logged product by its ID. Only the owner of the logged product can delete it.

Path Variables:
- logId: The ID of the logged product to delete

Business Rules:
- Users can only delete their own logged products
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone

Get all logged products for the current user on a specific date

Query Parameters:
- date: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., 2024-01-15)

Returns:
- All logged products for the specified date
- Calculated nutrition values for each product

Response Format:
Returns simplified data with only essential fields and calculated nutrition values

item.name: Get Logged Products by Meal Type

query.description: Meal type: breakfast, lunch, dinner, or snack

request.description:
Get all logged products for the current user of a specific meal type

Query Parameters:
- mealType: Type of meal (breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack)

Returns:
- All logged products for the specified meal type
- Calculated nutrition values for each product

Response Format:
Returns simplified data with only essential fields and calculated nutrition values

item.description:
Product consumption tracking endpoints for users to log their daily food intake and view calculated nutrition values

ðŸ’¡ IMPORTANT: When logging new products, you do NOT need to provide a logDate - the system automatically sets it to the current time!

item.name: Admin Management

request.description:
Get list of all users (Admin only)

Returns:
- User ID
- Username
- Role (USER/ADMIN)
- Creation date

Get specific user information by ID (Admin only)

Path Variables:
- userId: The ID of the user to retrieve

Returns:
- User ID
- Username
- Role (USER/ADMIN)
- Creation date

Update user role (Admin only)

Path Variables:
- userId: The ID of the user to update

Body:
- role: "USER" or "ADMIN"

Business Rules:
- Only admins can update roles
- Cannot update your own role through this endpoint

Delete a user account (Admin only)

Path Variables:
- userId: The ID of the user to delete

Business Rules:
- Only admins can delete users
- Admins cannot delete themselves
- Cannot delete the last admin user
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone

item.description: Admin user management endpoints (Admin role required)

item.name: Bulk Upload Management

request.description:
Upload a JSON file containing multiple products in bulk (Admin only)

Form Data:
- file: JSON file with product data (max 10MB)

File Requirements:
- Must be a valid JSON file
- Must have .json extension
- Maximum file size: 10MB
- Maximum 1000 products per file

File Format:
{
  "products": [
    {
      "ean13Code": "1234567890123",
      "productName": "Product Name",
      "amount": 100.0,
      "unit": "g",
      "calories": 150.0,
      "protein": 10.0,
      "carbs": 20.0,
      "fat": 5.0,
      "fiber": 3.0,
      "sugar": 2.0,
      "salt": 0.5
    }
  ]
}

Enhanced Validation Features:
- EAN13 codes are automatically cleaned (removes spaces, hyphens, dots, commas)
- Smart unit parsing (accepts 'gram', 'tablespoon', 'teaspoon', etc.)
- Calories is mandatory and must be > 0
- Optional nutrition fields default to 0.0 if not provided
- Detailed validation error messages with field-specific feedback
- Partial success: existing products are filtered out, new ones are added

Business Rules:
- Only admins can create bulk uploads
- All products must have unique EAN13 codes
- If ALL products already exist, returns 409 Conflict
- If SOME products exist, they're filtered out and new ones are added
- Enhanced error handling with appropriate HTTP status codes
- Transaction ensures data consistency

Get list of all bulk uploads (Admin only)

Returns:
- Bulk upload ID
- File name
- Product count
- Uploaded by username
- Upload date/time
- Status (PROCESSING/COMPLETED/FAILED)
- Error message (if failed)

Business Rules:
- Only admins can view all bulk uploads
- Results ordered by upload date (newest first)

Get list of bulk uploads created by the current admin user

Returns:
- Same fields as 'Get All Bulk Uploads' but filtered to current user

Business Rules:
- Only admins can view their own bulk uploads
- Results ordered by upload date (newest first)

Get specific bulk upload information by ID (Admin only)

Path Variables:
- bulkUploadId: The ID of the bulk upload to retrieve

Returns:
- Same fields as 'Get All Bulk Uploads' for the specific upload

item.name: Delete Products by Bulk Upload ID

request.description:
Delete all products associated with a specific bulk upload (Admin only)

Path Variables:
- bulkUploadId: The ID of the bulk upload whose products should be deleted

Business Rules:
- Only admins can delete products by bulk upload ID
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
- All products with the specified bulk upload ID are removed

item.description: Bulk upload management endpoints for admins to upload and manage multiple products at once

request.description:
Create a new meal with products

Example Response:
{
    "id": 1,
    "mealName": "Healthy Breakfast",
    "mealType": "breakfast",
    "createdBy": 1,
    "createdAt": "2025-08-31T17:21:52.788779",
    "updatedAt": null,
    "products": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "ean13Code": "1234567890133",
            "productName": "Organic Bananas",
            "quantity": 100.0,
            "unit": "g",
            "nutritionInfo": {
                "calories": 89.0,
                "protein": 1.1,
                "carbs": 22.8,
                "fat": 0.3,
                "fiber": 2.6,
                "sugar": 12.2,
                "salt": 0.0
            }
        }
    ],
    "totalNutrition": {
        "calories": 89.0,
        "protein": 1.1,
        "carbs": 22.8,
        "fat": 0.3,
        "fiber": 2.6,
        "sugar": 12.2,
        "salt": 0.0
    }
}

Note: Nutrition values are calculated based on the actual quantity entered, not the base product amount.

Retrieve a meal by its ID

Returns the complete meal with scaled nutrition information and total nutrition summary.

Nutrition values are calculated based on the actual quantities entered by the user, not the base product amounts.
Add a product to an existing meal
Update the quantity of a product in a meal
Remove a product from a meal
Delete a meal (only creator or admin)

Log a meal by its ID. This will log all underlying products into the logged_products table, calculating nutritional info based on product EAN, quantity, and unit. Returns confirmation of what was logged.

response.name: Success Response
response.body:
{
    "mealId": 1,
    "mealName": "Healthy Breakfast",
    "message": "Meal successfully logged to consumption history",
    "loggedAt": "2025-08-31T21:20:15.123456",
    "productsLogged": 2,
    "loggedProductDetails": [
        "1234567890133 (100.0 g)",
        "1234567890125 (250.0 ml)"
    ]
}

item.name: Nutrition Reports

request.description:
Generate a nutrition report for the authenticated user

Report Types:
- DAY: Single day report (use 'date' field with yyyy-MM-dd format)
- WEEK: Weekly report (use startDate and endDate with yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss format)
- MONTHLY: Monthly report (use 'date' field with any date in the month, yyyy-MM-dd format)
- CUSTOM: Custom date range (use startDate and endDate with yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss format)

Examples:
- DAY: {"reportType": "DAY", "date": "2024-01-15"}
- WEEK: {"reportType": "WEEK", "startDate": "2024-01-15T00:00:00", "endDate": "2024-01-21T23:59:59"}
- MONTHLY: {"reportType": "MONTHLY", "date": "2024-01-15"} (covers entire January 2024)
- CUSTOM: {"reportType": "CUSTOM", "startDate": "2024-01-01T00:00:00", "endDate": "2024-01-14T23:59:59"}

Response includes:
- Report ID for future reference
- Download URL for the generated PDF
- File size and generation timestamp

Generate a monthly nutrition report for the authenticated user

Monthly Report:
- Covers the entire month containing the specified date
- Use any date within the target month (e.g., 2024-01-15 covers all of January 2024)
- Automatically calculates start (1st of month) and end (last day of month) dates
- Perfect for monthly nutrition summaries and tracking

Example: {"reportType": "MONTHLY", "date": "2024-01-15"}

Response includes:
- Report ID for future reference
- Download URL for the generated PDF
- File size and generation timestamp

Generate a weekly nutrition report for the authenticated user

Weekly Report:
- Covers 1-7 days as specified by startDate and endDate
- Validates that the range is between 1-7 days
- Perfect for weekly nutrition tracking and analysis

Example: {"reportType": "WEEK", "startDate": "2024-01-15T00:00:00", "endDate": "2024-01-21T23:59:59"}

Response includes:
- Report ID for future reference
- Download URL for the generated PDF
- File size and generation timestamp

Generate a custom date range nutrition report for the authenticated user

Custom Report:
- Covers any date range up to 365 days
- Use startDate and endDate to specify exact range
- Perfect for specific tracking periods (e.g., 2 weeks, 3 months, etc.)
- Maximum range: 365 days

Example: {"reportType": "CUSTOM", "startDate": "2024-01-01T00:00:00", "endDate": "2024-01-14T23:59:59"}

Response includes:
- Report ID for future reference
- Download URL for the generated PDF
- File size and generation timestamp

Get all nutrition reports for the authenticated user

Returns a list of report summaries including:
- Report ID and name
- Report type and date range
- File size and generation timestamp
- Ordered by generation date (newest first)

Get a specific nutrition report by ID

Path Variables:
- reportId: The ID of the report to retrieve

Returns report summary details including metadata and download information

Download the PDF report file

Path Variables:
- reportId: The ID of the report to download

Returns the actual PDF file as a binary download

Note: This will trigger a file download in your browser/Postman

Delete a nutrition report

Path Variables:
- reportId: The ID of the report to delete

This will permanently delete both the database record and the PDF file

Returns 200 OK with success message

item.description:
Nutrition report generation and management endpoints

ðŸ“Š **Report Features**:
- Generate comprehensive nutrition reports with progress tracking
- Compare actual nutrition intake against user goals
- Breakdown by meal types (breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack)
- Download reports as PDF files
- Track report history and manage storage

ðŸ“… **Report Types**:
- **DAY**: Single day analysis
- **WEEK**: Weekly summary (1-7 days)
- **CUSTOM**: Flexible date range (up to 365 days)

ðŸ“ˆ **Report Content**:
- User information and report metadata
- Progress bars showing goal achievement
- Total nutrition summary
- Nutrition breakdown by meal type
- Detailed product log with timestamps

ðŸ’¾ **File Management**:
- Reports are stored as files on the server
- Each report has a unique ID for reference
- Download URLs are provided for easy access
- Reports can be deleted to free up storage space
